newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina considers depositing all pay in banks.
newsitem.headline: Argentina considers depositing all pay in banks.

text.p: The Argentine government is considering having all employers deposit workers' wages in bank accounts as a means of fighting tax evasion, an Economy Ministry official said.
"Payment would be made through savings accounts which would be free of cost (to employees)," Coordination Secretary Julio Caceres told reporters.
Having all wages channelled through the banking system would mean all such operations would be easier to track down and tax evasion made more difficult, Caceres said.

He said Economy Minister Roque Fernandez was keen on the idea, but some technical problems would have to be solved before it is implemented. One of the main obstacles is there are not enough automatic teller machines in the banking system.
More efficient tax collection is one of the government's primary means of increasing revenues and closing a fiscal gap expected to be between $5 billion and $6 billion this year.
